item.title: Mass civil wedding in Paraguay's capital sees more than 600 couples say 'I do' in unison
item.description: The event was part of a government campaign aiming to make civil weddings more accessible across the country.

item.title: Tigers end AFLW drought in shock 11-point win over Crows as Blues and Eagles enjoy victories
item.description: Richmond's dismal losing streak is over, with midfielder Monique Conti playing a starring role in a shock win over competition heavyweights Adelaide.

item.title: Authorities will investigate campfire that sparked major Moreton Island blaze
item.description: A "careless" campfire lit during a fire ban sparked a rapidly moving blaze that has now burnt hundreds of hectares on Moreton Island, according to authorities.

item.title: Liberty Bell Bay smelter receives first shipment of ore since flagging financial woes
item.description: A $20 million loan from the Tasmanian government to keep smelter Liberty Bell Bay afloat after it flagged financial woes earlier this year has led to the first shipment of ore being delivered.

item.title: Police seize 135 firearms in sovereign citizen raids across WA
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Mele Hufanga's NRLW premiership-winning try now an unsolvable mystery
item.description: Brisbane and the Roosters played one of the greatest games in NRLW history, but the controversial winning try to Mele Hufanga shapes as a football mystery that might never be solved.

item.title: Man in critical condition after shooting in Sydney's Croydon Park as police arrest alleged gunman
item.description: NSW Police say the alleged gunman had been "firing indiscriminately at passing vehicles including police vehicles".

item.title: Reece Walsh wins Clive Churchill Medal to ice Broncos' NRL premiership success
item.description: In one of the greatest individual performances in grand final history, Brisbane Broncos star Reece Walsh was judged player of the match after inspiring his side to their victory over the Melbourne Storm.

item.title: NRL grand final quick hits: Reece Walsh rushes to catch a concussed Ben Hunt and Broncos overcome injury toll
item.description: Reece Walsh put in an NRL grand final performance for the ages after an early stroke of luck as the Brisbane Broncos survived the loss of both Ben Hunt and Adam Reynolds to end a 19-year premiership drought.

item.title: How the internet reacted to Brisbane Broncos winning the NRL grand final
item.description: The internet could barely believe what was happening as Brisbane, fuelled by Reece Walsh's brilliance, came from behind to win the NRL grand final.

item.title: Why Brisbane Broncos's NRL premiership win is more about blood than gold
item.description: The Brisbane Broncos are flash and have never made apologies for it but, with their premiership win, they've proven they also have the true steel of champions.

item.title: Inside the mission to rescue dachshund Valerie from wild 529-day Kangaroo Island ordeal
item.description: Valerie's disappearance on South Australia's Kangaroo Island unleashed a 529-day hunt. She dodged rescue attempts and traps and had some wondering whether the sausage dog was mocking them and having the time of her life.

item.title: Documents reveal Australia's F-35 fighter jet export details 'quietly' disappeared
item.description: Department of Defence emails show that a website dedicated to Australia's role in the global F-35 supply chain used by Israel to maintain its fighter jets was removed at the start of the war in Gaza.

item.title: Housing supply without controlling demand suggests National Housing Accord won't fix affordability
item.description: The national project to fix housing affordability is off to a slow start but, from deposit schemes and negative gearing to immigration and construction delays, the reasons are complex.

item.title: Russia launches drone and missile strikes on Ukraine
item.description: Authorities say nine regions across Ukraine were targeted by Russian night-time drone, missile and aerial bomb strikes.

item.title: Melbourne Storm's new normal falls short in NRL grand finals and they're running out of chances
item.description: The new and infinitely more exciting Melbourne Storm are finding out just how hard it is to play their exciting brand of footy when the tension is at its peak.

item.title: SA seafood demand still down as algal bloom safety message struggles to break through
item.description: While industry and government tell consumers South Australian seafood is safe, consumer demand is still down amid the algal bloom, with businesses concerned they may not survive.

item.title: SA foster care providers working to bring more culturally and linguistically diverse carers into the system
item.description: Masooma came to Adelaide as a refugee from Afghanistan in 2016, and has become the carer of a young girl from a similar cultural background. Experts say it is important carers reflected the diversity of children in care.

item.title: The Sydney street workers helping get young people's lives back on track
item.description: Some of Sydney's vulnerable young people are being steered away from a life of crime, addiction and homelessness by a pair of youth workers who have had their own share of hardships.

item.title: The man most Palestinians want as their leader has spent years in solitary confinement
item.description: Despite spending more than 20 years behind bars, Marwan Barghouti is the man most Palestinians would want as their leader.

item.title: Decades-old 'conversion therapy' resurfaces in today's trans youth healthcare debate
item.description: A decades-old psychiatric study is influencing current debates over transgender youth health care. But a new analysis led by a survivor says the findings were deeply harmful and dangerously misleading.

item.title: Older Territorians say they still feel unsafe as residents' homes targeted by armed thugs
item.description: There are growing calls for the NT government to ban machetes and crossbows as older residents share horror stories of being targeted in their own homes by armed youths.

item.title: Ten years on from 2015, Ben Hunt wins the Broncos premiership he's waited for his whole life
item.description: Defeat in the 2015 decider was so scarring, Hunt eventually felt the need to move away from the club he loves. Ten years later and back in his home colours, he's a 350-game, premiership-winning NRL player.

item.description: Business owners worry major changes to a buy now, pay later system used by about 500,000 social security recipients will cause a raft of issues when it begins next month.

item.description: More than a dozen customers of MJ Harris Group have told the ABC they have been left significantly out of pocket after the company went into liquidation this week.

item.description: Farmers are calling for a cull of kangaroos, which they say are being forced onto farmland by drought and dry conditions and consuming what little feed and water they have.

item.title: Recently-elected German mayor Iris Stalzer in critical condition after being stabbed outside home
item.description: Iris Stalzer, a Social Democrat who was elected mayor of Herdecke in the Ruhr region a week ago, is reportedly suffered life-threatening injuries.

item.title: Research shows females carry a much higher genetic risk for major depression than males
item.description: In a study involving about 200,000 people diagnosed with depression, scientists have identified almost twice as many genetic red flags in the DNA of females compared with males.

item.title: Victorian charity linked to proposed Greensborough tower controlled by for-profit Melbourne firm Tetris Capital
item.description: A Victorian housing charity awarded more than $200 million in taxpayer funds for a proposed 17-storey tower is controlled by a for-profit investment firm, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: AFP Commissioner Krissy Barrett speaks with the ABC.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: New AFP boss warns hate crime laws may need to be strengthened further
item.description: In a wide-ranging interview as she begins as AFP commissioner, Krissy Barrett announces a new sub-terror strike force, and flags that newly written hate crime laws may need to be strengthened further.

item.title: Class actions accuse two top Australian universities of misleading and deceptive conduct
item.description: Students have been left with HECS debts and careers that are "non-existent" after completing degrees that were not accredited. Class actions have been launched against two Australian universities.

item.title: Up to 3,000 flood victims' details have been given to ChatGPT. What does that mean for privacy?
item.description: Data experts say it is hard to know what the implications are for 3,000 flood victims who have had personal information uploaded to the AI platform by a government contractor.

item.title: Bluescope chief demands urgent action on 'broken' gas market to save industry
item.description: A future made in Australia? Not if gas prices keep rising, major manufacturers warn as they call for urgent action to secure affordable supply.

item.title: When is the 2025 Bathurst 1000? And what weather is forecast for the Supercars on Mount Panorama?
item.description: The 2025 Bathurst 1000 gets underway this weekend. Here's all you need to know before the 68th running of the iconic endurance race.

item.title: Anika Wells points to surprise stress test of triple-0 network ahead of bushfire season
item.description: The adequacy of Australia's emergency call network will be stress tested with a surprise drill ahead of bushfire season, as the opposition ramps up its assault over the communication minister's handling of last month's fatal triple-0 outage.

item.title: 'Everyday living cost' or assistive technology? NDIS participants frustrated with flexibility of rules
item.description: A year after a controversial NDIS change, advocates are growing increasingly concerned that "counterintuitive" and "nonsensical" funding decisions are reducing participant independence.

item.title: Warragul social group helping parents of children with disability find connection
item.description: Parents of children with disability can miss out on social support, but a Victorian physiotherapist hopes to change that.

item.title: Audit finds state government-run aged care facility inappropriately used restraints
item.description: A South Australian government aged care home, which looks after 23 people with dementia or complex disabilities, inappropriately used lap belts and other mechanical restraints to stop falls and control residents' behaviour, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Can Donald Trump win the Nobel Peace Prize? Experts say it's unlikely
item.description: US President Donald Trump has made no secret that he wants to win this year's Nobel Peace Prize. Here's why experts say it's unlikely he'll win the prestigious award.

item.title: Tourism operators seek more funding to mitigate algal bloom impact in SA over summer
item.description: Tourism, seafood industry and community representatives are calling for greater funding, education and travel incentives ahead of the release of the South Australian government's upcoming Summer Plan.

item.title: Sheffield Shield round one quick hits: Marnus Labuschagne enjoys timely century while Ashes Test hopefuls struggle
item.description: The Sheffield Shield is underway, with all eyes on the contenders for Australia's problematic opener spot. Here are five quick hits from the opening round of the season.

item.title: Pentagon nominee John Noh discusses the AUKUS review at his confirmation hearing
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: R360 players to be banned from international rugby union
item.description: Rugby union players who sign up for the R360 breakaway franchise league will be ineligible for international selection, national governing bodies have confirmed.

item.title: Tasmanian government stadium report responds to planning commission's criticisms
item.description: The state government response to last month's scathing report from the planning commission says that while "change can be challenging", the "dream of a Tasmanian team representing our state in the AFL and AFLW is now within reach — we cannot turn back".

item.title: Gaza mother explains what it's like raising a newborn after October 7
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Born as the first bombs fell, two-year-old Mohammad has known nothing but war
item.description: Children in Gaza are experiencing grief, loss, displacement, and starvation. For some, this is all they know or remember.

item.title: Federal politics live: Email detailing Optus triple-0 outage sent to wrong government mailbox
item.description: The communications department did not find out about the Optus outage for more than a day after it occurred because an email was sent to the wrong address, Senate estimates has heard. Follow live.

item.title: LeBron James 'retirement' teaser that blew out ticket prices for Lakers games ends up being an ad
item.description: LeBron James's "retirement teaser" — which blew out ticket prices for the LA Lakers' final home game of the regular season — ends up being an advertisement for cognac.

item.title: Australian wins with a jaffle at World Porridge Making Championship
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Trump says US will 'do everything possible' to prevent war if Hamas agrees to peace deal
item.description: Donald Trump insists the United States will "do everything possible" to prevent Israel restarting the war in Gaza, in the event Hamas agrees to a peace deal.

item.title: Gold price hits record high, topping $US4,000 an ounce for first time, amid US shutdown and lower interest rates
item.description: The price of gold has hit another record and is set to become Australia's second most valuable resource export after iron ore.

item.title: Calls for national gambling watchdog grow amid NT conflict allegations
item.description: The NT government is standing by its de-facto regulation of Australia’s $50 billion online gambling industry, despite allegations that it is too closely linked to the sector.

item.title: NSW Police intercept alleged 'kill team' near daycare centre in Revesby
item.description: Police say tactical officers foiled an alleged planned hit near a daycare centre in Revesby in Sydney's south-west on Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: US Senate committee questions Trump's Pentagon nominee John Noh over AUKUS review
item.description: The AUKUS submarine pact may need "commonsense" action from both Australia and the US to make it more "sustainable", according to Donald Trump's nominee to oversee US defence strategy in the Indo-Pacific.

item.title: Regulator investigating WA fire that burnt 11,000ha and left residents homeless
item.description: Residents who lost their homes in a blaze that ripped through WA's southern wheatbelt in January may have to wait more than two years to seek compensation.

item.title: A juvenile wild saltwater crocodile was found with its mouth zip-tied. The river tour guides who spotted the crocodile were able to remove the restrai
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Saltwater crocodile found with mouth zip-tied shut in Adelaide River, sparking calls for stronger penalties
item.description: The discovery of a saltwater crocodile with its mouth bound shut by zip ties in a Darwin river has sparked outrage, with animal rights advocates calling for stronger wildlife protections.

item.title: As WA government looks set to bring Serie A game involving AC Milan to Perth, some football fans are not happy
item.description: Italian heavyweights AC Milan look set to play a match, for actual Serie A points, in Perth. What will the state government pay to lure them here, and why are some football supporters unhappy?

item.title: Markets live: Australian dollar jumps to 10-month high against yen, ASX slips as gold price hits new record
item.description: The Australian dollar surges against the Japanese yen on speculation its central bank will delay lifting interest rates, while the ASX 200 begins its day with a slight fall and the gold price surges above $US4,000 an ounce. Follow live.

item.title: Surge in shark-tracking app downloads following fatal Sydney attack
item.description: There has been a surge in downloads of the SharkSmart app following the fatal attack of a Northern Beaches surfer — in a sign the incident has left some nervous to get back into the water.

item.title: Players concerned over Shanghai heat as Novak Djokovic collapses on court
item.description: Holger Rune says "there is always a limit" as soaring temperatures and humidity in Shanghai and Wuhan tennis events cause player distress.

item.title: AFL trade period, day three live updates: Brandon Starcevich, Zach Merrett, Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca among big names on the move
item.description: Gold Coast secures a first-round pick from St Kilda in exchange for Sam Flanders, which could open the doors to a deal being done with Melbourne for Christian Petracca. Follow live.

item.title: Police investigating after body found on road in Newborough, Gippsland
item.description: The discovery was made early this morning. Traffic diversions are in place and specialist detectives are set to investigate.

item.title: Australian merino wool future positive after surging price restores grower confidence
item.description: Amid a run of price rises at Australian wool auctions, the next generation of growers say global demand and fresh confidence could mark a turning point for the fibre.

item.title: Taylor Swift wears Adelaide label Paolo Sebastian in The Fate of Ophelia music video
item.description: Founder and designer Paul Vasileff says he's grateful to have his Adelaide-made couture dress on the world stage with pop superstar Taylor Swift wearing it in the new The Fate of Ophelia music video.

item.title: Neighbour of Kotoni Staggs pays tribute to Broncos star after supporting family through husband's death
item.description: The neighbour of Kotoni Staggs pays tribute to the Broncos star for helping her through a devastating family death.

item.title: Taylor Swift ‘bejewelled’ in dress made by Aussie fashion designer in new music video
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australians are reading less than ever before. Here's how to read more books
item.description: Research shows Australians are reading fewer books than ever before. One writer shares her advice on how to make reading a daily habit.

item.title: Democrats and Republicans clash in fiery Senate hearing
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Pam Bondi accused of using justice system to target Donald Trump's opponents
item.description: US Attorney-General Pam Bondi has faced heated questioning from senators over claims she's transforming the justice department into a "shield for the president and his political allies".

item.title: Arsenal lose 2-1 to Lyon at Women's Champions League as trio of Matildas feature
item.description: Arsenal goes down 2-1 to Lyon in the Women's Champion League as three Matildas stars make an appearance at Meadow Park.

item.title: WA iron ore mining shows no signs of slowing despite price drop concerns
item.description: Australia's two biggest iron ore miners continue to expand their operations in WA's Pilbara, despite warnings of waning demand.

item.title: More families raising children with cystic fibrosis staying in the bush
item.description: Two mums in rural Queensland have spoken about why they choose to live more than 1,000 kilometres from the Queensland Children's Hospital.

item.title: Federal support for national Aboriginal art gallery in Alice Springs in doubt
item.description: The Northern Territory treasurer says the federal government will not support the proposed Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander art gallery in Alice Springs in its current form.

item.title: Single farmers in Western Australia ditch dating apps for something face to face
item.description: When the dating app radius won't reach the edge of your property, and you're harvesting grain from sun-up til sundown, how do you find a partner?

item.title: Rental prices have risen almost 44 per cent in five years, Cotality review finds
item.description: Median rental prices have risen to more than $700 per week for the first time, according to Cotality's Quarterly Rental Review.

item.title: Hundreds of sexual offence cases potentially compromised amid Victoria Police audit
item.description: Police are alerting hundreds of accused sexual offenders that their cases may be compromised by the work of a digital forensics officer based in Bendigo.

item.title: Brewer stages beer boycott over Kangaroo Island ferry's 'ridiculous' fares
item.description: A Kangaroo Island brewer says he will no longer supply beer to the island's ferry service, amid a growing outcry over the high cost of fares to the popular international tourism destination.

item.title: WA's Bibbulmun Track running record broken twice in one week
item.description: Two men have smashed the record for completing one of the world's longest walking tracks in the fastest time, within days of each other.

item.title: Minjee Lee eyes top spot in golf's end-of-season rankings race
item.description: Australian superstar Minjee Lee is in line for several big awards as the 2025 golf season enters the home stretch in Asia.

item.title: Glencore refinery sites stay open with taxpayer funds
item.description: The last Australian copper smelter processing third-party product will stay open after its owner accepted a support package.

item.title: Broken Hill nurse to represent Australia at Ironman World Championship — Women
item.description: Broken Hill nurse Bella Kolinac, 23, will represent Australia at the Ironman World Championship — Women in Kona, Hawaii.

item.title: Last night's harvest moon made for stunning photos. When is the next supermoon?
item.description: Stargazers from around the world have captured the luminous glow of October's supermoon.

item.title: Sam Kerr to play for Matildas for the first time in two years
item.description: Sam Kerr's two year absence from the Matildas is almost over, she's set to feature in friendlies later this month, while Mary Fowler is recovering well from her own ACL injury.

item.title: Australian Gaza flotilla member criticises federal government after being detained by Israel
item.description: An Australian activist accuses the federal government of not providing enough support after she and other members of a flotilla were detained by Israel.

item.title: More than 500 hikers reportedly rescued after being stranded on Mount Everest
item.description: Hundreds of trekkers, villagers and support staff have safely reached the Tibetan town of Qudang, according to Chinese state media.

item.title: Geelong Cats fined by AFL over third-party arrangements
item.description: The AFL fines Geelong $77,500 for failing to disclose third-party agreements with players over a six-year period.

item.title: High Court backs use of encrypted app to monitor crime figures after challenge by accused bikies
item.description: The High Court has ruled on the use of information gathered through the AN0M app, which was developed by the Australian Federal Police for surveillance.

item.title: Mark Latham goes on tirade outside court, as ex-partner pleads not guilty to intimate image charges
item.description: Independent MP Mark Latham has launched a tirade against former partner Nathalie Matthews during an ongoing legal battle, on the same day she pleaded not guilty to intimate image charges in a separate matter.
